articles.author: Will Hyde
articles.text:
The strain submissions keep rolling in, so a big thank you to the Leafly faithful who have submitted new strain requests via the Leafly app this week! Here are five of the latest and most popular submissions we received. If you have tried any of the newest strains in the Leafly Strain Explorer, make sure to rate and review them. You can also check to see which ones are available near you by clicking the “Availability” tab on our website and app. Get out there and find the newest varieties of cannabis in the Leafly database to try!

1. Super Cheese
Characteristics of Super Cheese:

Super Cheese, bred by Positronics, is a throwback to the old school strains that filled the coffee shops of Amsterdam in the late 1980s. Super Cheese was created through inbreeding, crossing Cheese genetics with another select phenotype believed to be Exodus Cheese. The aroma of this indica-dominant hybrid is a mix of skunky musk and a pungent blue cheese funk that has become synonymous with Cheese varieties. The flavor is a strong, smooth blend of bittersweet herbs and cream, like an earthy buttermilk.


2. 1024
Characteristics of 1024:

1024 is a sativa-dominant hybrid bred in Spain by Medical Seeds Co. The breeders claim to guard the secret genetics due to security reasons, but regardless of its genetic heritage, 1024 is a THC powerhouse with a sweet and spicy bouquet. Subtle fruit flavors mix with an herbal musk to produce uplifting sativa effects. One specific phenotype is noted for having a pungent odor that fills a room, similar to burning incense.


3. 501st OG
Characteristics of 501st OG:

501st OG, bred by Rare Dankness, is an indica-dominant hybrid that crosses Skywalker OG with Rare Dankness #1. The colorful flowers are tinged with a wide spectrum of green, blue, red, and purple hues that give off a deep piney Kush aroma that mixes with the sweetness of grape flavors. The potent indica effects make 501st OG a great nighttime strain to help with pain relief and trouble sleeping.


4. Blueberry Essence
Characteristics of Blueberry Essence:

Blueberry Essence is a high-CBD cannabis strain bred by Life Gardens in Washington. The undisclosed genetics produce purple buds that come with a mellow, fruity aroma and an earthy aftertaste that entices medical marijuana patients with its ability to combat an array of symptoms and conditions. Blueberry Essence relaxes away pain with a tingly sensation that reverberates throughout your extremities, providing a calming sense of bliss that eventually levels off to help induce sleep.


5. Burkle
Characteristics of Burkle:

Burkle is an indica-dominant hybrid that crosses Pre-98 Bubba Kush with Granddaddy Purple (though some claim it to be Purple Urkle based on the name). The result is a powerfully relaxing indica that consumes the body with calming effects that ease away pain and induce sleep. Burkle is great for a lazy evening at home, but not so great for being productive. Its sweet flavor profile is a blend of spiced licorice aromas and an earthy peppermint aftertaste. This strain is known to produce a case of the munchies which makes it a good choice for those suffering from a lack of an appetite.
articles.title: New Strains Alert: Super Cheese, 1024, 501st OG, Blueberry Essence, and Burkle

description: Burkle, 3rd place winner of Best Indica Flower at the 2016 Colorado Cannabis Cup, is an indica-dominant hybrid that crosses Pre-98 Bubba Kush with Granddaddy Purple (though some claim it to be Purple Urkle based on the name). The result is a powerfully relaxing indica that consumes the body with calming effects that ease away pain and induce sleep. Burkle is great for a lazy evening at home, but not so great for being productive. Its sweet flavor profile is a blend of spiced licorice aromas and an earthy peppermint aftertaste. This strain is known to produce a case of the munchies which makes it a good choice for those suffering from a lack of an appetite.

Burkle is great for a lazy evening at home, but not so great for being productive. Its sweet flavor profile is a blend of spiced licorice aromas and an earthy peppermint aftertaste. This strain is known to produce a case of the munchies which makes it a good choice for those suffering from a lack of an appetite.

highlightedReviews.text:
Location: Lightshade on 6th
THC: 16.69%
CBD: Unknown 
THC-A: 10.28%

Additional Notes: I saw this strain at Lightshade on 6th about a month ago while visiting Denver, but wasn't able to try them. The looks and smell were almost identical both visits. 

Appearance Rating: 5.00 Appearance Description: These Burkle are truly beautiful. They're a neon green color with some pieces showing more purple than others. They have orange hairs and an abundance of well developed Trichromes. The manciure job was just about perfect.

Taste Rating: 5.00 
Taste Description: The smell of these after my first visit to Lightshade left my mouth watering. So when I tried them and they tasted as delicious as they smell, I was delighted. You're greeted with a fruity blueberry flavor with a touch of grape on the inhale and initial exhale. As the flavor sits on your pallet, you catch earth and pine. 

Effects Rating: 5.00 
Effects Description: I find this to be a very interesting indica. When I was up and about, needing to be social, it was not a problem. When I got home and sat down, I almost immediately felt the indica relaxation hit me. There was no anxiety or paranoia at all. 

Overall Rating: 5.00
Overall Summary: It was great the taste and high lived up to the smell and looks. I would highly recommend you try this even if Indicas aren't your preference. Their flavor alone is worth experiencing. 

I'm Keith Von Fraichen ... You Keep On Fraiching
Site says not available in Henderson NV, but I justed picked up some @Jenny's

name: Burkle
